content:
• Tuesday, June 19, 2012
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT), which closed at $26.52 today, announces it has amended its merger...

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT), which closed at $26.52 today, announces it has amended its merger agreement with Insight Venture. Insight's buyout price is now $25.75/share, up from a prior $23/share. As part of the amendment, which is the result of a $25.50/share bid reportedly from Dell (DELL-OLD), Quest has agreed to increase its termination fee to $25M from a prior $6.3M. Quest -1.6% AH to $26.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -4%) finished lower following its FQ4 report, as the Street registered...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -4%) finished lower following its FQ4 report, as the Street registered its dismay with declining Nook hardware sales. The results suggest B&N is a victim of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) on multiple fronts: not only is the iPad making life difficult for all would-be tablet rivals, it's quickly eating into the e-reader market. IDC recently predicted e-reader shipments would fall slightly in 2012, while tablet shipments grow nearly 60%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • FSII

    More on FSI International's FQ3: Though results beat estimates, the chip equipment maker is...

    More on FSI International's FQ3: Though results beat estimates, the chip equipment maker is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $40M-$45M, below a consensus of $48.1M. Also, net income is expected to fall to $4M-$5M from FQ3's $10M, which suggests EPS will be well below the $0.18 consensus, and orders are expected to fall from FQ3's $41.8M. FSI blames macro uncertainty, along with timing issues related to facility construction and upgrade projects. FSII -15.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • ADBE

    More on Adobe's FQ2: Deferred revenue rose $43.9M Q/Q to $592.8M, and digital marketing sales...

    More on Adobe's FQ2: Deferred revenue rose $43.9M Q/Q to $592.8M, and digital marketing sales (boosted by acquisitions) rose 35% Y/Y. Citing weak Euro demand, Adobe expects FQ3 revenue of $1.075B-$1.125B and EPS of $0.56-$0.61, mostly below a consensus of $1.13B and $0.61. It expects FY12 revenue growth of 6%-7% and EPS of $2.40-$2.46 vs. a consensus of 6.6% and $2.44. FQ3 guidance could heighten concerns about the transition to a subscription model. ADBE -4.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • FSII

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII): FQ3 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $50.8M (+98.3% Y/Y)...

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII): FQ3 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $50.8M (+98.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.4M. Shares -13.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ2 EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.12B (+10% Y/Y) beats by...

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ2 EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.12B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ3 EPS of $0.64 in-line. Revenue of $4.25B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $40M....

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ3 EPS of $0.64 in-line. Revenue of $4.25B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSN

    Shares of Samson Oil & Gas (SSN -21.5%) plunge after the company provides operational...

    Shares of Samson Oil & Gas (SSN -21.5%) plunge after the company provides operational updates on its Hawk Springs and Roosevelt projects; the swabbing process revealed an oil cut of ~20% in one of four wells.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 5 Comments
  • X

    A surge in imports of steel products into the U.S. so far this year could threaten the market...

    A surge in imports of steel products into the U.S. so far this year could threaten the market for steel pipes for the oil and gas industry, one of the strongest sectors in the market, U.S. Steel (X +9.4%) CEO John Surma says. The sharp jump of imports of steel pipe into the U.S. is a sign foreign companies could be breaching global trade rules, he says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • PKI

    PerkinElmer (PKI +3%) holds on to gains late in the day after being upgraded to Conviction Buy...

    PerkinElmer (PKI +3%) holds on to gains late in the day after being upgraded to Conviction Buy on valuation at Goldman this morning, citing its margin expansion potential and low NIH funding. Price target is $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • SBOW

    Swift Energy (SFY +4.1%) shares maintain gains on news of a long-term agreement with Eagle Ford...

    Swift Energy (SFY +4.1%) shares maintain gains on news of a long-term agreement with Eagle Ford Gathering, a JV between Kinder Morgan Partners (NYSE:KMP) and Copano Energy (NASDAQ:CPNO) to process natural gas in South Texas. SFY expects to have up to 40M cubic feet of gas/day of firm capacity available on the system by Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • CMI

    Cummins (CMI +2.8%) holds on to gains despite cautious comments out of Credit Suisse earlier...

    Cummins (CMI +2.8%) holds on to gains despite cautious comments out of Credit Suisse earlier today. The firm says the stock will likely be choppy given macro concerns, but it expects the company to outgrow its core markets longer term. The company reiterates its Outperform rating, but lowers its price target to $136 from $146.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AGN

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1.8%) gains after being upgraded to Conviction Buy on valuation at...

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1.8%) gains after being upgraded to Conviction Buy on valuation at Goldman, citing its premium growth and likely tentative approval for Lidoderm. The firm keeps its price target at $87.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +6.9%) shares rally as Brazil's energy minster signals a new willingness to...

    Petrobras (PBR +6.9%) shares rally as Brazil's energy minster signals a new willingness to consider raising regulated gasoline prices unchanged since 2008. Edison Lobao, who as recently as June 13 said Brazil wouldn’t increase gasoline prices this year, now says the government is "studying the topic and will have a conclusion in some time."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 (FFIV -2.7%) trades lower after Lazard slashes its estimates on a belief an expected slowdown...

    F5 (FFIV -2.7%) trades lower after Lazard slashes its estimates on a belief an expected slowdown in service provider sales could be worse than expected. However, the firm is maintaining a Buy, and has a PT of $133. Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) recently attributed its soft July quarter guidance to depressed carrier capex. William Blair cut its numbers for F5 yesterday on concerns about U.S./Euro enterprise IT spending, but to little effect.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • SAM

    Boston Beer (SAM +4.4%) trades higher after entering an agreement with Berkshire Mountain...

    Boston Beer (SAM +4.4%) trades higher after entering an agreement with Berkshire Mountain Distillers to turn thousands of gallons of Samuel Adams Boston Lager and Cinder Bock into whiskeys to be sold under the Samuel Adams name. Berkshire will initially retain all profits from the venture.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • SM

    SM Energy (SM +7%) is reaffirmed as a favorite Buy at Canaccord, which sees natural gas...

    SM Energy (SM +7%) is reaffirmed as a favorite Buy at Canaccord, which sees natural gas liquids stabilizing and says the cost/recovery relationship suggests "capital productivity is superior rather than inferior to industry." The firm expects production growth to accelerate in H2 with the alleviation of Eagle Ford infrastructure constraints.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • RLD

    Shares of RealD (RLD +7.3%) shoot up with early reviews from Europe on Sony's (SNE +1.1%) The...

    Shares of RealD (RLD +7.3%) shoot up with early reviews from Europe on Sony's (SNE +1.1%) The Amazing Spider-Man (trailer) largely favorable on the movie and the integration of RealD technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK +5.6%) says it will cut 8% of its workforce at its prolific Barnett shale field...

    Chesapeake (CHK +5.6%) says it will cut 8% of its workforce at its prolific Barnett shale field in Texas as drilling slows, and will entertain offers on its Fort Worth office tower that it bought for $100M in 2008. CHK has pledged to sell up to $11.5B in assets this year to fill a projected $4B-$5B shortfall.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 8 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +2%) gains after Barclays says it remains a top pick in Israel, given an...

    Mellanox (MLNX +2%) gains after Barclays says it remains a top pick in Israel, given an expanding addressable market and solid market share gains. The firm rates shares an Overweight with a $65 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +5.2%) shares post strong gains after UBS upgrades its stock rating to Buy...

    Valero Energy (VLO +5.2%) shares post strong gains after UBS upgrades its stock rating to Buy from Neutral, viewing the current level as an attractive entry point after falling 13% since February. The firm sees the upcoming completion of a hydrocracker project at VLO's Port Arthur refinery setting the stage for reduced capex and a $1.9B increase in free cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • NVMI

    Chip equipment maker Nova Measuring (NVMI +5.4%) rallies after Stifel starts coverage with a Buy...

    Chip equipment maker Nova Measuring (NVMI +5.4%) rallies after Stifel starts coverage with a Buy and $11 PT, arguing the company is well-positioned to benefit from ongoing chip industry investments in new manufacturing processes. The firm sees these investments increasing the share of capex allocated to process control solutions such as Nova's to 15-%-17% from a current 12%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • BZ

    Boise (BZ +2%) gains after CLSA calls the stock " meaningfully undervalued " and well positioned...

    Boise (BZ +2%) gains after CLSA calls the stock " meaningfully undervalued " and well positioned to capitalize on strategic opportunities due to its strong balance sheet. The firm rates the shares at Buy with a $12 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN +0.75%) and not Dendreon (DNDN -3.5%) is the more attractive acquisition...

    Medivation (MDVN +0.75%) and not Dendreon (DNDN -3.5%) is the more attractive acquisition target, says Jefferies analyst Biren Amin. This is because of the bright prospects for MDV3100, the prostate-cancer drug that Medivation half owns and the poor outlook for provenge, Dendreon's rival treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • MAKO

    Jefferies says its analysis of Mako Surgical (MAKO +4.2%) points to considerable upside . After...

    Jefferies says its analysis of Mako Surgical (MAKO +4.2%) points to considerable upside . After reviewing its free cash flow yield and historical valuation relative to Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +1.2%) and other traditional medical device names, Jefferies believes the shares are significantly undervalued. The firm reiterates a buy at current levels and maintains an Overweight rating on the stock with a $49 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +5.2%) will receive up to $51M in aid from Connecticut after...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +5.2%) will receive up to $51M in aid from Connecticut after agreeing to move its global HQ to New Haven from Cheshire, both of which are in the state. Alexion is expected to create as many as 300 jobs with the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • IPI

    Intrepid Potash (IPI +1.8%) shrugs off a tepid initiation at Underperform from RBC Capital this...

    Intrepid Potash (IPI +1.8%) shrugs off a tepid initiation at Underperform from RBC Capital this morning, as a strong rally in corn futures supports the entire sector. RBC made the cautious call due to IPI's low share count, high-than-average operating costs and increased leverage.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • CLH

    Energy worries create a buying opportunity in Clean Harbors (CLH +4.1%), Wunderlich says. While...

    Energy worries create a buying opportunity in Clean Harbors (CLH +4.1%), Wunderlich says. While 25% of CLH revenues are tied to servicing of the oil and gas industry, the company has limited direct exposure to the oil price and rig counts, the firm says; most of CLH energy revenues are linked to Canadian oil sands production, which is forecast to remain strong.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • HCP

    Health-care REIT HCP Inc. (HCP +0.8%) bounces back from an early sell off after the facilities...

    Health-care REIT HCP Inc. (HCP +0.8%) bounces back from an early sell off after the facilities manager earlier agreed to sell 7.8M shares to Citigroup (C +3.8%). The company plans to utilize the proceeds to repay debt as well as various other corporate needs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +7.4%), no stranger to short squeezes, is spiking higher amidst reports...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +7.4%), no stranger to short squeezes, is spiking higher amidst reports a group of Memphis-area businessmen have offered to buy the Memphis Grizzlies should a $350M bid from Ubiquiti CEO Robert Pera falter. Pera's bid, which almost certainly would require him to sell a large chunk of his Ubiquiti shares to finance the deal, is still being reviewed by the NBA, though a source close to Pera says the deal remains in place.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • MAR

    Starwood Hotels (HOT +4.5%) plans to promote its collection of light-rich Element Hotels on the...

    Starwood Hotels (HOT +4.5%) plans to promote its collection of light-rich Element Hotels on the summer solstice with a pair of free Aviator sunglasses for guests. The line of environment-friendly hotel has been steadily growing since its launch in 2008 and has been adding more punch to Starwood's bottom line than anticipated by many skeptics.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford (WFT +2.9%) wins an $843M crucial oil field facilities contract from a group led by...

    Weatherford (WFT +2.9%) wins an $843M crucial oil field facilities contract from a group led by Eni (NYSE:E) that will boost oil production from Iraq's Zubair oil field to 554K bbl/day from the current 254K bbl/day, a government spokesman says. Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) and an Italian JV had competed for the contract to build the facilities in Basra in southern Iraq.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • SIRI

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +4.1%) shoot higher on the strength of some outsized block...

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +4.1%) shoot higher on the strength of some outsized block trades. SA author Crunching Numbers says shares could trek back to $2.15 based on implications of where Liberty Media sees fair value.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +1.6%), Lockheed Martin (LMT +1%) and Eurofighter are all bidding for a $6.9B fighter...

    Boeing (BA +1.6%), Lockheed Martin (LMT +1%) and Eurofighter are all bidding for a $6.9B fighter aircraft deal with South Korea as U.S. and European defense companies look towards Asia to counter declining sales at home. BA’s F-15 Silent Eagle, LMT’s F-35 Lightning II and the Eurofighter Typhoon are all in competition for the contract, which is expected to be announced in October.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (LAYN +3.6%) acquires the remaining 50% interest it didn't own in Brazilian...

    Layne Christensen (LAYN +3.6%) acquires the remaining 50% interest it didn't own in Brazilian construction company Costa Fortuna Fundacoes e Construcoes for $16M, as the drilling services provider looks to expand its geotechnical construction capabilities in South America.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • AKS

    Cowen says Alkermes (AKS +1.9%) recent pullback is a buying opportunity despite the lowered FY13...

    Cowen says Alkermes (AKS +1.9%) recent pullback is a buying opportunity despite the lowered FY13 guidance. The firm believes the key components of the investment thesis remains intact, including performance of key products and its undervalued pipeline. The firm maintains an Outperform rating on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +12.4%) soars a day after merger partner Innovate/Protect receives a favorable...

    Vringo (VRNG +12.4%) soars a day after merger partner Innovate/Protect receives a favorable Markman ruling in its infringement suit against AOL, Google, and others. Possibly helping is an analysis from SA's James Altucher, who argues the broad definitions granted by the ruling for I/P's patent claims increase the likelihood Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) AdWords search ad platform will be declared to infringe on an I/P patent for ranking search and ad results based on clicks. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • MGM

    Casino stocks (BJK +2.7%) are showing strength and breaking out of their weekly trading range as...

    Casino stocks (BJK +2.7%) are showing strength and breaking out of their weekly trading range as Macau stays in focus. Traders sentiment seems to be tipping toward the notion that while gaming growth estimates are declining, they still look solid compared to other sectors and justify valuations. Advancers: MGM +2.2%, LVS +2.4%, PNK +3.1%, MPEL +3.5%, WYNN +3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD -4.9%) move lower with numbers from Walgreen on display and in advance...

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD -4.9%) move lower with numbers from Walgreen on display and in advance of the company's FQ1 report set for Thursday. The drugstore operator's prescription totals will be dissected closely to see how much growth is emanating from the WAG-ESRX dispute and how much is tied to its capital investments in store improvements.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    Deutsche Bank calls the surprise departure of J.C. Penney's (JCP -10.2%) President Michael...

    Deutsche Bank calls the surprise departure of J.C. Penney's (JCP -10.2%) President Michael Francis a "a catastrophic blow" for the bull case in the stock, given the timing of the announcement and his short tenure. Mr. Francis was expected to play a key role in revamping the stores image and was considered vital to the store's recruitment of new brands. The firm maintains a Hold rating on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment

  • Europe screams higher into the close, apparently helped by some confusion over credit rating...

    Europe screams higher into the close, apparently helped by some confusion over credit rating reform coming out of Brussels (with Bloomberg mistakenly running a headline that the EU is scrapping ratings, real story here). Stoxx 50 +1.9%, led by Milan +3.2%. The euro +1% to $1.2700.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +3.2%) signs an agreement to develop its R256 asthma drug with...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (RIGL +3.2%) signs an agreement to develop its R256 asthma drug with AstraZeneca (AZN +3%) in a deal that could be worth $100M plus royalties if the treatment ever reaches market. There's still a long way to go, as R256 is yet to be tested on humans. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • MAR

    Marriott (MAR +4.2%) provides more details of its global expansion plans, saying it intends to...

    Marriott (MAR +4.2%) provides more details of its global expansion plans, saying it intends to spend $2B over the next three years on opening hotels and $600M on renovating existing sites. The company plans to double the number of hotels in China to over 100 as it looks to exploit the growth of international tourism and of the local middle class.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • HCSG

    After taking an 8% hit yesterday on a negative research report, Healthcare Services (HCSG +2.3%)...

    After taking an 8% hit yesterday on a negative research report, Healthcare Services (HCSG +2.3%) gets a boost this morning from a valuation upgrade to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus. The firm says the sell off was overdone, and that turmoil in the regulatory and reimbursement environment for nursing homes will continue to benefit the nursing-home services company as it attracts new customers looking to cut costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • VXX

    A four (going on 5) day wipe out in the VIX (VXX -2.1%) erases nearly the entirety of its...

    A four (going on 5) day wipe out in the VIX (VXX -2.1%) erases nearly the entirety of its 10-week advance, as the lack of disaster this weekend in Greece is enough - for now - to allow markets to move on. Also hurting VXX returns is a volatility market in contango, forcing losses on holders as futures contracts get rolled every 3 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 7 Comments
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (NYSE:TI) +7.3% on reports it's in talks with state financing group CDP about...

    Telecom Italia (NYSE:TI) +7.3% on reports it's in talks with state financing group CDP about spinning off its €15B fixed-line ops. While TI and CDP deny the speculation, a source says the "time is right" to start negotiations. TI Chairman Franco Bernabe has repeatedly insisted the carrier will retain control of the network, while CDP is providing up to €500M to a rival broadband project.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (MCD -0.9%) takes a turn lower as the company warns at the Jefferies Global Consumer...

    McDonald's (MCD -0.9%) takes a turn lower as the company warns at the Jefferies Global Consumer Conference (webcast) that discretionary visits by customers could be hard to grow at a brisk pace. The company presented a slide showing that it plans to add 1.3K new restaurants in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) +4.4%, possibly because it reportedly pulled out of a supply contract with...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) +4.4%, possibly because it reportedly pulled out of a supply contract with India's BSNL, saying it couldn't match ZTE's low $842M bid. While ZTE is the main supplier, ALU, along with Ericsson (ERIC +3.2%), NSN (NOK, SI) and China's Huawei, was short-listed for parts of the deal. The other three firms have also withdrawn.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 5 Comments
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (MSFT +3.5%) jumps following the introduction of Surface (I, II), as hopes grow that...

    Microsoft (MSFT +3.5%) jumps following the introduction of Surface (I, II), as hopes grow that Windows 8 will emerge as a legit rival to the iPad (NASDAQ:AAPL). Analysts are praising Surface - S&P is upgrading Microsoft to Strong Buy - but also note the tablet's potential to create tension with Windows OEMs; Dell (DELL-OLD -1.5%) is notably selling off today. Aware of this issue, Microsoft suggests Surface will be priced on par with other Windows 8 tablets, and, for now at least, only plans to sell it online and at Microsoft Stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 9 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P -2.8%) sells off after Spotify launches a free, ad-based, Internet radio service for...

    Pandora (P -2.8%) sells off after Spotify launches a free, ad-based, Internet radio service for U.S. users that strongly resembles Pandora's. But while Pandora's service relies on a music-analysis algorithm, Spotify's uses a "social graph" of user activity. Pandora's market share has thus far held up well in the face of new competition. One reason: the time spent by Pandora users to create personalized stations creates a switching cost that discourages many from leaving. (previous) (Songza)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • CBOU

    Caribou Coffee (CBOU +6.1%) goes on a run to hit a ten-week high. Though the broad theme of...

    Caribou Coffee (CBOU +6.1%) goes on a run to hit a ten-week high. Though the broad theme of lower coffee commodity prices is the headliner on CBOU, the company has also been quietly staying aggressive by upgrading its menu and increasing its brand awareness with strategic placements in grocery stores and club stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY +3.5%) shows an early gain, with a little help from Microsoft's launch of a...

    Best Buy (BBY +3.5%) shows an early gain, with a little help from Microsoft's launch of a Windows 8 tablet. The premise goes that any product that keeps the steady stream of consumers from marching like ants into Apple stores for tablets could potentially help the retail chain stay relevant.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 5 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +4.1%) rallies after the company discloses the ARM-based version of Microsoft...

    Nvidia (NVDA +4.1%) rallies after the company discloses the ARM-based version of Microsoft Surface will run on a Tegra app processor (the specific Tegra chip remains a mystery). Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) upcoming Nexus tablet, which really has its work cut out for it now, is expected to use a Tegra 3 processor. Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) decision to go with Nvidia is a minor disappointment for Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM), which announced a Windows 8 partnership with Microsoft at CES.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP -9.6%) takes it on the chin in early trading after its "Dream Team" of...

    J.C. Penney (JCP -9.6%) takes it on the chin in early trading after its "Dream Team" of executive talent loses one of its marquee names. The buzz on the Street is on whether or not Ron Johnson will be given enough time to see his planned transformation of the retailer start to hit the company's bottom line. (Earlier: Citi defends JCP)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • NEI

    Struggling server appliance vendor Network Engines (NASDAQ:NEI) is being acquired by...

    Struggling server appliance vendor Network Engines (NASDAQ:NEI) is being acquired by privately-owned Unicom Systems for $63.2M, or $1.45/share, in cash. The deal's price represents an 85% premium to NEI's Monday close. NEI shares were crushed earlier this year after the company announced top customer EMC will be transitioning away from its products. Shares are halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) +2% after Credit Suisse reiterates an Outperform ahead of tomorrow's FQ3...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) +2% after Credit Suisse reiterates an Outperform ahead of tomorrow's FQ3 report. The firm expects improvements in the profitability of Micron's DRAM ops (bleeding huge sums of cash until recently) and second consecutive quarter of healthy free cash flow will "likely act as positive catalysts." But the firm thinks more clarity is needed about what will happen to acquisition target Elpida's capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) +4.9% after providing its FQ4 report and FQ1 guidance ahead of schedule, and...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) +4.9% after providing its FQ4 report and FQ1 guidance ahead of schedule, and throwing in a $10B stock buyback. Canaccord (Hold) sees the quarter as "a favorable read-through" for software companies. Goldman (Buy) points out both software license and hardware sales were better than expected (ed: the latter was still down 16% Y/Y). Arik Hesseldahl notes Larry Ellison's earnings call boast that Oracle is now the world's #2 cloud software firm (behind Salesforce.com).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures hold steady gains following a mixed housing report and ahead of...

    Market preview: Stock futures hold steady gains following a mixed housing report and ahead of the FOMC's policy meeting, from which markets are hoping to be thrown more candy.
